subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: [Call for QS ... voting in January] - Peter's revised proposal
msgSnippet: Why be so pessimistic, Paul? We ve lengthened the time frame, with January for collecting, discussing and refining proposals. Voting won t be until February.
messageBody:
Why be so pessimistic, Paul? We've lengthened the time frame, with
January for collecting, discussing and refining proposals. Voting
won't be until February. Let's wait and see how many people vote. As
to fairness, I think we should just use the 'Polls' feature on the
group website and see what we get. Unless it's a tie, it's fair.

If someone doesn't vote, it's not a vote for continuing to use the
Jerome keyboard layout--it's probably just because that person simply
doesn't use a computer for QS. If someone cares enough to vote, then
they have an opinion. Whatever the outcome, people can start using the
winning keyboard layout right away for email to this group (as I see
being done in the Shavian group). It would certainly be nice if font
developers such as yourself provided a font that supports the outcome.
As I did before with QS-SAMPA, I'll create a font that uses the
winning layout, using the Jerome glyphs.

By the way, would you like to update the proposal under your name in
the document 'qs_keybd_proposals.csv'?

Ted


On Dec 24, 2007 9:05 AM, <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> On Mon, December 24, 2007 05:16, peter_r_guinness wrote:
> > Hello all,
> >
> >
> > I have revised my original mapping proposal.
> > My goals for the mapping remain as before:
> > - the mapping should be easy to learn/remember as well as easy and
> > efficient to type, - also it should be easy to read when the required
> > quikscript font is missing and the text is subsequently displayed in a
> >
>
> I'm glad that users are really seriously proposing alternate key mapping,
> but I can't say that we are ready to vote on anything. We have not set
> rules up for what constitutes a fair vote. I expressed concern before that
> we might get as few as 15 users voting. In that case, we won't have a good
> representation of what users really want, and I can't see myself changing
> my keyboard mappings based on such an inaccurate vote.
>
> Paul
>
>

If someone doesn't vote, it's not a vote for continuing to use the
